intro: Verbesina ilicifolia, commonly known as golden beggar's-ticks, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. The plant has hairy, serrated leaves and produces small, spiny fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, sunny habitats such as wetlands and disturbed soils. Botanically, it belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes other showy flowering plants.
